channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TX
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TX

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Leaking package was placed inside tote box, waiting to be taken to hazmat. DescribePack: The bottles were packed upside down and during transit or unload/load the bottles were crushed. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed inside tote box..

item.title: Report X-2023071177
item.description:
Report X-2023071177

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-15T18:13:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-17
  • City: EDINBURG
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was scanned to work area 141 at 9:43 am on 07/17/2023. Then at 12:01 pm It was scanned code 10 (inspection required). Package was left at QA1 in a plastic bag with the package covered in white paint. When QA arrived in the morning and began to process packages left at QA1 the packages was found in the damaged package area. Upon closer inspection it was found that the package was a HazMat. Package was placed in salvage drum secured to be processed post sort. DescribePack: Inside the package was found 4 x 1 gallon paint cans. All 4 were dented, soiled/stained in white paint, and 1 had its top come off and was empty. 90% of the interior of the package was coated in paint. Approximately 60% of the exterior of package was coated in white paint. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: The package was found inside of a clear plastic bag at QA1 damaged package area. Then placed in a salvage drum by QA when it was discovered that it was a HazMat. After which it was secured to be processed post sort.

item.title: Report X-2023071149
item.description:
Report X-2023071149

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-15T18:13:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-17
  • City: SAN ANTONIO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: package was properly loaded onto ISP vehicle. while driving package was not secured enough making it slightly move around which led bottle with loose caps leak and damaged packaging. Upon arrival, VSA/QA were notified and hazmat was properly secured and spill was cleaned up. DescribePack: loose caps. leaking package 1 gallon bottle leaked top of package completely soaked. bottom corners also wet and leaked through. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: spill pads were used and later cleaned by hazmat specialist

item.title: Report E-2023070806
item.description:
Report E-2023070806

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-15T18:13:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-19
  • City: WALLER
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 19, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon jug of corrosive liquid (UN3266) was damaged during transit and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to adjacent freight. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted surface. Crews observed all the freight was removed and shipped. The two (2) 5-gallon jugs left were not damaged. LSH personnel utilized absorbent wipes to wipe down the impacted area. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 5-gallon bucket to be staged onsite for future disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023070791
item.description:
Report E-2023070791

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-15T18:13:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-21
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics - LHO experienced a UN1263 E347 Genie Blue (APS) Equipment Enamel release from a 5-gallon metal pail and a UN1263 Endura Paint Topcoat A White (APS SA Panel) release from a 5-gallon metal pail. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and advised terminal personnel has already conducted cleanup. It was advised approximately 1-ounce of UN1263 E347 Genie Blue (APS) Equipment Enamel was released due to improper loading and 1-cup of UN1263 Endura Paint Topcoat A White (APS SA Panel) released to the trailer floor due to a forklift puncture. The product were containerized into a 10-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023071034
item.description:
Report X-2023071034

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-10T21:10:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-10
  • City: CORPUS CHRISTI
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: P&D DRIVER PICKED UP PACKAGE FROM SHIPPER AND LATER NOTICED A GASOLINE SMELL. CSA WENT AND RETRIEVED THE PACKAGE FROM THE DRIVER AND BROUGHT IT BACK TO THE STATION. WHEN WE OBSERVED THE PACKAGE, WE NOTICED THE SMELL OF GASOLINE AND THAT SOME OF THE BOX ON THE INSIDE WAS WET FROM IT LEAKING. DescribePack: THERE WAS NO DAMAGE. THIS WAS AN RTS PACKAGE GOING BACK TO WALMART THAT THE SHIPPER DID NOT COMPLETELY BLED THE LINES OF FLUIDS. IT IS A USED LAWN MOWER. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: IT LEAKED OUT AND THE BOX ABSORBED IT.

item.title: Report X-2023071092
item.description:
Report X-2023071092

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-10T21:10:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-14
  • City: AUSTIN
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: VSA got notice from driver about the damage hazmat in their truck; was damaged around 5pm, got driver to pull truck aside from building and remove package, broken glass, and sweep inside the truck. Took package with the broken glass away from the building until being staged in Hazmat Cage. DescribePack: Top of package's tape was loose and one bottle fell out during transit. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Clean up the truck and removed the damaged glass.

item.title: Report X-2023070893
item.description:
Report X-2023070893

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-09T18:14:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-10
  • City: EDINBURG
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Management had someone inbound the ICs at the front of belt 1. This person found the hazmat damaged and immediately notified belt 1 manager. This occurred prior to the arrival of any QA personnel so the manager placed the item in a bin and brought it to QA 1. DescribePack: The packaging has come undone from the area in which it was originally glued/sealed together. The tape at the base of the package came completely off and the tape at the top is only attached to the top front flap. The only side of the package that appears to not have any damage is the front, the rest of the sides appear to be wet damaged. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: When management was first made aware of the damaged hazmat, the package was removed from the loading area and brought to QA in a bin. As soon as QA was made aware the contents were secured in a yellow salvage drum and secured to be processed post sort.

item.title: Report E-2023070715
item.description:
Report E-2023070715

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-09T18:14:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-17
  • City: BAYTOWN
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While loading the IBC into a van trailer, a Veolia operator noticed the IBC had leaked nearly a gallon of waste on to the ground. The leak appeared to be coming from a outlet on the bottom of the valve. The valve would have to fail for this to happen. The outlet was plugged with spill pads temporarily to contain the leak and the waste was transferred in to another tote for continued transportation to the disposal facility.

item.title: Report E-2023070694
item.description:
Report E-2023070694

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-09T18:14:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-17
  • City: IRVING
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Lone Star Hazmat Response was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 5ft-by-5ft area of the trailer floor and a 2ft-by-2ft area of asphalt yard. Lone Star Hazmat Response personnel estimated that five (5) gallons of material was released due to loose caps on almost all the 1-gallon plastic jugs on the pallet. Lone Star Hazmat Response personnel removed all the plastic jugs from the cardboard packaging and verified that all the jugs were impacted from the pallet. Lone Star Hazmat Response deployed Sodium Bicarbonate to neutralize the impacted areas and then placed down Oil Dri as an absorbent. The spent material was gathered and placed into two 55-gallon poly drums along with the impacted cardboard. The impacted 1-gallon plastic jugs were containerized into two 95-gallon poly drums and two (2) 55-gallon poly drums. The generated waste was labeled and staged in a secure location onsite at the terminal prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

  • Description: RESPONDER DISPATCHED TO A CALL AT UNLOAD, TOOK FULLY STOCKED AND WEARING MY PPE(BOOTS, APRON, BLUE LATEX GLOVES, SILVER SHIELD GLOVES, GREEN NITRILE GLOVES, YELLOW ARM SLEEVES AND GOGGLES) AND SET UP MY 15 FOOT HOTZONE, RESPONDER THEN VISUALLY INSPECTED THE LEAKING PACKAGE AND SAW THAT THE BOX WAS MARKED AS A HAZARDOUS PACKAGEAND ALSO HAD UPS SHIPPING PAPERS ATTACHED TO IT AND A CORROSIVE #8 DIAMOND STICKER, USED DECISION TREE AND FOLLOWED THE STEPS ACCORDINGLY. RESPONDER FOLLOWED THE PROCEDURE TO CLEANING UP A CORROSIVE SPILL, COLLECTED ALL THE CONTAMIATED PACKAGES IN THE AREA AND RETURNED TO THE DMP AREA.
